abstracts.cdata!:
Implementation of the Greater Addo
            Elephant National Park Project will establish a
            mega-biodiversity conservation area in, and around the
            existing Addo Elephant National Park, an area of global
            biodiversity value, which contains five, out of seven plant
            biomes found within South Africa, in addition to the
            proposed adjoining marine environment, which is also of
            considerable biodiversity value. The project will therefore
            support the expansion of the Park, and marine protected
            areas, significantly boosting eco-tourism. To this end, land
            acquisition is already taking place, therefore, this
            resettlement action plan sets the policy framework in
            compliance with the Bank operational policy, and the
            country's legal framework guiding the principles for
            compensation, income restoration, and implementation and
            monitoring arrangements. A Resettlement Working Group has
            been set up to include maximum participation by the affected
            people in the resettlement process, to identify displaced
            populations from appropriated farms. Alternative
            accommodation, and facilities will be provided for loss of
            access to farms, also allowing, the possibility to work for
            the Poverty Relief program, while SANParks negotiates with
            the Department of Housing, the necessary funds per household
            to build new housing in the town of the affected
            people's choice. Appropriate jobs have been identified
            for displaced persons, and, training will be provided to
            ensure satisfactory performances in their new jobs, as part
            of the identified capacity building program. An
            investigation of the viability of alternative income
            generating strategies is ongoing, particularly through
            negotiations with the Department of Land Affairs in terms of
            the Land Reform Grants, which would afford a specified grant
            for each household, through which profitable agricultural
            activities may result.
